<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 170, 293]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 298, 329, 314]]<|/det|>
Paper 6 Alternative to Practical  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 278, 905, 293]]<|/det|>
0625/63  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 299, 905, 314]]<|/det|>
May/June 2018  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 320, 905, 335]]<|/det|>
1 hour  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 339, 415, 355]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 366, 375]]<|/det|>
No Additional Materials are required.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 432]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 320, 447]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 447, 502, 462]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 462, 504, 477]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 476, 380, 491]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 502, 255, 516]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 516, 361, 531]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 530, 767, 546]]<|/det|>
You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 555, 604, 571]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 759, 586]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A student is investigating how partly covering the surface of the water in a beaker affects the rate at which the water cools.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 455, 136]]<|/det|>
The apparatus used is shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[326, 151, 687, 358]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 375, 532, 393]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 407, 146, 425]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[52, 435, 945, 490]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 505, 532, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 536, 750, 555]]<|/det|>
Record the room temperature \(\theta_{\mathrm{R}}\), shown on the thermometer in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[549, 597, 920, 617]]<|/det|>
<form>\(\theta_{\mathrm{R}} =\) .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 630, 146, 648]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 630, 920, 663]]<|/det|>
The student pours \(100 \text{cm}^3\) of hot water into a beaker. She places lid \(\mathbf{A}\) on the beaker. This leaves half of the water surface uncovered, as shown in Fig. 1.3.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 661, 903, 677]]<|/det|>
She records the temperature of the water in the beaker and immediately starts a stopclock.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 675, 912, 688]]<|/det|>
She records the temperature \(\theta\) of the water every 30 s. Her readings are shown in Table 1.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 689, 920, 722]]<|/det|>
She repeats the procedure using lid \(\mathbf{B}\). This leaves a quarter of the water surface uncovered, as shown in Fig. 1.4.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[89, 736, 460, 907]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[470, 737, 907, 907]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[225, 920, 295, 938]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.3

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[608, 920, 678, 938]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.4

beaker with lid Abeaker with lid B
\(t/\)\(\theta /\)\(\theta /\)
080.081.0
77.079.0
74.577.5
72.576.0
70.575.0
69.074.0
68.073.5
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 389, 146, 408]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 389, 920, 422]]<|/det|> Describe a precaution that should be taken to ensure that the temperature readings are as accurate as possible in the experiment. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 466, 920, 484]]<|/det|> [1] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 497, 148, 516]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 497, 160, 515]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 497, 908, 530]]<|/det|> Write a conclusion to this experiment, stating for which lid the rate of cooling is greater. Explain your answer by reference to the results. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 637, 920, 655]]<|/det|> [2] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 668, 183, 686]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 668, 920, 700]]<|/det|> Suggest a change to the apparatus that could produce a greater difference between the rates of cooling for lid \(\mathbf{A}\) and lid \(\mathbf{B}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 714, 688, 732]]<|/det|> Explain why the change might produce a greater difference. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 745, 920, 763]]<|/det|> change ................................................................................................................................... <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 808, 920, 825]]<|/det|> explanation ................................................................................................................................... <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[893, 853, 920, 871]]<|/det|> [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
A student suggests that the rate of cooling is directly proportional to the percentage of the uncovered surface area. He wants to draw a graph of cooling rate against the percentage of uncovered area to investigate this.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 920, 167]]<|/det|>
Describe how his graph line will show whether the rate of cooling and the percentage of uncovered surface area are directly proportional.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 242, 143, 260]]<|/det|>
<label>(f)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 242, 640, 260]]<|/det|>
Students in other countries carry out the same experiment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 273, 883, 291]]<|/det|>
Suggest one factor that they should keep the same if they are to obtain similar readings.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[833, 365, 920, 383]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 448, 122]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 420, 137]]<|/det|>
